logs_dashboards_description: Dashboards are graphic representations of your logs. The various modules (curves, pie charts, counters, statistics, etc.) give you an overall summary view of your data. Are you looking to find out how many errors occurred over the past 24 hours? Whether the trend is upward or downward? Or which page was most visited today? How many customers this month? All this information and more is at your fingertips. Having several dashboards means that you can display data for specific contexts, which makes the information itself easier to interpret.

logs_welcome_title: Logs Data Platform is a logs management system designed by OVH
logs_welcome_description_1: Index and analyse your logs in real time. Receive alerts about any downtime. Share your data with your employees.
logs_welcome_description_2: Logs Data Platform is a comprehensive platform you can use to manage and analyse your company's logs. You can get an overall view of how well your physical and virtual servers are running. You can also see how well your cloud-based and mobile applications are running. This means you can anticipate potential incidents, and be notified if your resources experience any downtime.
logs_accounts_description: Logs Data Platform is a comprehensive platform you can use to manage and analyse your company's logs. You can get an overall view of how well your physical and virtual servers are running. You can also see how well your cloud-based and mobile applications are running. This means you can anticipate potential incidents, and be notified if your resources experience any downtime.

logs_update_capped_description: By activating this option, Logs Data Platform will pause indexing for all of your traffic when the volume of your logs reaches your solution’s threshold. At the beginning of each month, the indexing for your traffic will be automatically reactivated.

logs_home_info: Logs Data Platform is an interface for gathering, indexing and analysing logs. Wherever your logs are from, you can use the platform to choose different entry points depending on the protocol, security level and format. You can use and analyse data with the various APIs and web interfaces.

logs_tokens_description: To grant external applications access to your logs, and to automate certain tasks, you will need to give them access to the APIs. The most secure way to manage this access is by using authentication tokens. By using this feature, you no longer need to enter your credentials into the configuration files.

logs_streams_description: With streams, you can classify your logs into precise categories in real time, as soon as they arrive on the Logs Data Platform. If you have several streams, you can also store messages easily based on their source (the application or server they originated from), and create different levels of confidentiality for different streams, which means you can grant access to authorised people only. Here, the tokens are write tokens, which can be used to direct logs to the appropriate stream. Generally, having multiple streams makes it a lot easier to search your logs, since you no longer need to exclude the results from another system or application.

streams_alerts_current_title: Manage your alerts for the {{ name }} data stream
streams_alerts_intro_text: Once you have set up your alerts, you no longer need to monitor your logs - the platform does it for you. A number of different use cases are liable to trigger an alert, which will then be sent to you by email: a lack of messages from a specific software application for an unusually long time, if the number of tasks carried out is unusually low, if traffic on your website is very high, or if certain keywords in particular appear on your stream.
streams_alerts_delete_message: Are you sure you want to delete the {{alert}} alert?
streams_alerts_delete_error: An error has occurred deleting the {{alertName}} alert: {{message}}
streams_alerts_condition_message_count: The alert is triggered when there have been {{thresholdType}} than {{threshold}} message(s) in the last {{time}} minutes. The {{queryFilter}} filter is applied, and {{backlog}} messages will be included in the notification.
streams_alerts_condition_field_value: The alert is triggered when the {{field}} field has a value {{thresholdType}} {{constraintType}} than {{threshold}} in the last {{time}} minutes. The {{queryFilter}} filter is applied, and {{backlog}} messages will be included in the notification.
streams_alerts_condition_field_content_v: The alert is triggered when a message containing the field {{field}} with the value "{{value}}" is received. The {{queryFilter}} filter is applied, and {{backlog}} messages will be included in the notification.
create_alert: Create an alert with the following as a condition
add_alert_title_message_count: Create a number of messages condition
edit_alert_title_message_count: Modify the number of messages condition
add_alert_description_message_count: This condition is triggered when the number of messages is higher or lower than the defined threshold for a given period.
add_alert_description_field_value: This condition is triggered when the aggregate value for a field is higher or lower than a defined threshold over a given period.
add_alert_description_field_content_valu: This condition is activated when the content of the messages equals a defined value.
add_alert_time_period_field_description: Evaluate the condition for all messages received within the given number of minutes.
add_alert_threshold_type_field_descripti: Select the condition that will trigger the alert, e.g. more/fewer messages than the threshold.
Select the condition that will trigger the alert: e.g. when the value is higher/lower than the threshold.
add_alert_threshold_field_description: The value that triggers the alert if it is exceeded.
add_alert_grace_period_field_description: The number of minutes to wait after an alert has been resolved before re-issuing an alert.
add_alert_accumulation_field_description: The number of messages to include in the alert notifications.
add_alert_notification_field_description: Tick this box to send notifications every time the condition for the alert is met, regardless of the alert's status.
add_alert_field_field_description: Name of the field to be checked.
add_alert_constraint_type_field_descript: Select the statistic function to use in this aggregation
add_alert_value_query_filter_description: Search criteria to apply to filter messages from this traffic.
add_alert_value_field_description: The value to be compared against the field's value.

inputs_intro_text: Data-gathering tools are software packages used to recover logs from servers or applications. They are an effective way to process and convert logs into GELF format, which is compatible with the Logs Data Platform. You no longer need to dedicate hardware resources to this task, or check that your infrastructures are available - we will do it for you. With this platform, you can connect these tools to your different streams for a simplified configuration, secured via firewall rules.

logs_index_description: Logs Data Platform lets you create and host Elasticsearch indexes. These indexes can be used for the configuration data of a Kibana instance, indexing your statistical data, and enriching or correlating your logs. You can then use these indexes with most tools and applications that are compatible with the Elasticsearch REST API.
